availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James W. Wilson (Crittenden County, Kentucky, farmer.)

body.p: Crittenden County, Kentucky, farmer. Married to Rebecca Bridges in Livingston County, Kentucky, on September 7, 1822. Father of W. F. Wilson and R.W. Wilson. Postmaster for Willow Grove in Crittenden County, Kentucky on October 24, 1843. Merchant and Farmer in Crittenden County, Kentucky in 1850. Farmer in Crittenden County, Kentucky in 1860. Died in 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Crittenden, District 1, p. 213B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Crittenden, Marion (West Half), p. 406.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Livingston County Marriages, Film 000318176.
Record of Appointment of Postmasters, 1832-1971, NARA Microfilm Publication, M841, Records of the Post Office Department, Record Group Number 28, [p. 596, Casey-Graves], (accessed via Ancestry.com).
